snippet: A decision to suspend the training of new Afghan Local Police recruits was the first tap on the brakes for one of the most controversial programs in the Afghan security plan.
abstract: News analysis; decision by Maj Gen Raymond Thomas III to suspend the training of new Afghan Local Police recruits signals a slowing of the military's aggressive and controversial plan to fill out the Afghan police force; decision also reflects growing concerns that the entire plan to train Afghan forces, a linchpin of the withdrawal strategy, has grown so quickly that it has put intense strain on the system to weed out bad or disloyal candidates.

byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Matthew Rosenberg and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington, and Sangar Rahimi and Habib Zahori from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: A decision to suspend the training of new Afghan Local Police recruits was the first tap on the brakes for one of the most controversial programs in the Afghan security plan.

headline.seo: In Afghanistan, Hitting Pause on Local Police Training
